newsitem.title: USA: Viacom exercises option for UPN stake.
newsitem.headline: Viacom exercises option for UPN stake.

text.p: Viacom Inc said Wednesday it had exercised its option to purchase a 50 percent stake in United Paramount Network (UPN) from BHC Communications Inc, a subsidiary of Chris-Craft Industries Inc.
Viacom said it would jointly own and operate the network with BHC, effective January 15.
The exercise required an investment by Viacom of about $160 million, or about half of the capital invested in UPN to date by BHC, Viacom said.
UPN, a national broadcast network, was created in January 1995 by BHC and Paramount Television Group, which is part of the Viacom Entertainment Group.
Viacom said it had the right to exercise its UPN partnership option by giving notice to BHC by December 15.
